title: Geordie Shore star Sam Bentham reveals the cast’s near miss with an avalanche in the French Alps
text:
The Geordie Shore cast narrowly missed disaster in the French Alps (Picture: Karwai Tang/WireImage) The Geordie Shore cast narrowly escaped an avalanche in the French Alps while filming the new series.
The likes of Chloe Ferry, Gaz Beadle and Scotty T – along with the new cast members – were whisked off to Tignes ski resort for a skiing trip last month.
A fatal avalanche hit the day after the Geordie Shore team left the resort. Four people were killed.
Star Sam Bentham, who makes his debut in season 14, recalled the cast feeling shaken after learning about the horrific event.
He told The Sun : ‘There was an avalanche literally where we went skiing in Tignes in the Alps.
‘There was an avalanche the day after where we stayed. Four people died.
Sam Bentham said the cast didn’t find out until they got back to the UK (Picture: David Fisher/REX/Shutterstock) ‘We aren’t allowed phones or newspapers during filming, so we didn’t know until we got back.’
The 400 metre-wide avalanche struck an off-piste slope on February 13, and was thought to have been caused by a group of skiers higher up.
A Geordie Shore rep has been contacted for comment.
